verses.kjv: Moreover the word of the LORD came unto me, saying,
verses.ct: The LORD's message came to me:

verses.kjv: Son of man, set thy face against mount Seir, and prophesy against it,
verses.ct: "Son of man, turn against Mount Seir and prophesy against it.

verses.kjv: And say unto it, Thus saith the Lord GOD; Behold, O mount Seir, I am against thee, and I will stretch out mine hand against thee, and I will make thee most desolate.
verses.ct: Tell it: This is what the Lord GOD says — Pay attention, Mount Seir! I am against you. I will raise my hand against you and turn you into a complete wasteland.

verses.kjv: I will lay thy cities waste, and thou shalt be desolate, and thou shalt know that I am the LORD.
verses.ct: I will destroy your cities, and you will become desolate. Then you will know that I am the LORD.

verses.kjv: Because thou hast had a perpetual hatred, and hast shed the blood of the children of Israel by the force of the sword in the time of their calamity, in the time that their iniquity had an end:
verses.ct: Because you held an endless grudge and slaughtered the people of Israel with the sword during their time of disaster, when their punishment reached its climax —

verses.kjv: Therefore, as I live, saith the Lord GOD, I will prepare thee unto blood, and blood shall pursue thee: sith thou hast not hated blood, even blood shall pursue thee.
verses.ct: therefore, as surely as I live, declares the Lord GOD, I will hand you over to bloodshed, and bloodshed will chase you down. Since you did not hate bloodshed, bloodshed will chase you down.

verses.kjv: Thus will I make mount Seir most desolate, and cut off from it him that passeth out and him that returneth.
verses.ct: I will turn Mount Seir into a complete wasteland and eliminate everyone who travels through it or returns to it.

verses.kjv: And I will fill his mountains with his slain men: in thy hills, and in thy valleys, and in all thy rivers, shall they fall that are slain with the sword.
verses.ct: I will cover its mountains with the dead. Those killed by the sword will fall on your hills, in your valleys, and along all your streams.

verses.kjv: I will make thee perpetual desolations, and thy cities shall not return: and ye shall know that I am the LORD.
verses.ct: I will make you a permanent ruin, and your cities will never be inhabited again. Then you will know that I am the LORD.

verses.kjv: Because thou hast said, These two nations and these two countries shall be mine, and we will possess it; whereas the LORD was there:
verses.ct: Because you said, 'These 2 nations and these 2 lands will belong to me, and we will take possession of them' — even though the LORD was there —

verses.kjv: Therefore, as I live, saith the Lord GOD, I will even do according to thine anger, and according to thine envy which thou hast used out of thy hatred against them; and I will make myself known among them, when I have judged thee.
verses.ct: therefore, as surely as I live, declares the Lord GOD, I will treat you according to the anger and jealousy you showed in your hatred toward them. I will reveal myself among them when I judge you.

verses.kjv: And thou shalt know that I am the LORD, and that I have heard all thy blasphemies which thou hast spoken against the mountains of Israel, saying, They are laid desolate, they are given us to consume.
verses.ct: Then you will know that I am the LORD. I have heard every insulting thing you said against the mountains of Israel, saying, 'They are ruined! They have been handed over to us to devour.'

verses.kjv: Thus with your mouth ye have boasted against me, and have multiplied your words against me: I have heard them.
verses.ct: You bragged against me with your mouths and piled up your words against me. I heard every one of them.

verses.kjv: Thus saith the Lord GOD; When the whole earth rejoiceth, I will make thee desolate.
verses.ct: This is what the Lord GOD says: While the whole earth celebrates, I will make you desolate.

verses.kjv: As thou didst rejoice at the inheritance of the house of Israel, because it was desolate, so will I do unto thee: thou shalt be desolate, O mount Seir, and all Idumea, even all of it: and they shall know that I am the LORD.
verses.ct: Just as you celebrated over the land belonging to the house of Israel because it was ruined, I will do the same to you. You will become desolate, Mount Seir — you and all of Edom. Then they will know that I am the LORD."
